Σύνολα:
Οι σύνολα (arrays) είναι μορφές αποθήκευσης, οι οποίες αποθηκεύουν αντικείμενα.
Η Python δέχεται μόνο ακόμη "untyped" arrays, αφού "typed" arrays (όπως int64, float32) απαιτούν Cython.
Οι arrays διαθέτουν:
-   Μόνο fixed-size αντικείμενα (δύσκολη/δυσχέρη αλλαγή)
-   Απόδοση
-   Πως "typed", arrays (όπως int64, float32) απαιτούν Cython
-   Δυσχέρης/δύσκολος callbacks
-   Δυσχέρη/δύσκολος slicing (χρήση `view`/`slice` methods)
-   Δυσχέρη/δύσκολος casting (χρήση `reshape`/`view`/`copy` methods)

Λίστες:
Οι lists (lists) είναι collections, όπως arrays, αφού διαθέτουν αρίθμητα.
Οi lists, αφάνθηκαν, tσώζουν "references" (pointing to objects). Oi lists "point" to objects (όχι objects themselves), which are referenced by the list.
Τώρα, για objects, lists "point" to references. Tώρα, objects are referenced by the list.
Oi lists:
-   Διάθέτουν:
    -   Μόνο fixed-size objects ("references", pointing to objects) (δύσκολη/δυσχέρη αλλαγή)
    -   Απόδοση
    -   Πως "typed", lists (όπως int64, float32) απαιτούν Cython
    -   Δυσχέρη/δύσκολος callbacks
    -   Δυσχέρη/δύσκολος slicing (χρήση `view`/`slice` methods)
    -   Δυσχέρη/δύσκολος casting (χρήση `reshape`/`view`/`copy` methods)
source: "Εξήγησε τη διαφορά ανάμεσα σε σύνολα και λίστες στην Python."

Κώδικας:
```
local function findNearestCharacter(position)
    local closestCharacter, closestDistance = nil, math.huge
    for i,v in pairs(workspace:GetChildren()) do
        if v:IsA("Model") and v ~= game.Players.LocalPlayer.Character then
            local charPosition = v.PrimaryPartCFrame:pointToObjectSpace(v.PrimaryPart.CFrame.p)
            local distance = position:Distance(charPosition)
            if distance < closestDistance then
                closestCharacter, closestDistance = v, distance
            end
        end
    end
    return closestCharacter, closestDistance
end
```

Walt Disney's career began in the early days of animation when he worked as an animator for the Laugh-O-Gram studio in Kansas City. He then moved to Hollywood in the late 1920s and founded the Disney Brothers Cartoon Studio with his brother Roy. The studio was later renamed Walt Disney Productions and produced some of the most iconic animated films of all time, including Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs (1937), Pinocchio (1940), Fantasia (1940), Dumbo (1941), Bambi (1942), Cinderella (1950), Alice in Wonderland (1951), Peter Pan (1953), Lady and the Tramp (1955), Sleeping Beauty (1959) and Mary Poppins (1964).

In addition to producing animated films, Walt Disney also created theme parks such as Disneyland in California and Walt Disney World Resort in Florida. He also developed new technologies such as multiplane cameras which allowed for more realistic animation techniques than ever before.

Walt Disney's legacy continues to this day through his company which has grown into one of the largest media conglomerates in the world with divisions dedicated to film production, television programming, theme parks & resorts management & merchandising among others. His influence on popular culture cannot be overstated; from Mickey Mouse to Star Wars there are few aspects of modern life that have not been touched by some aspect or another of Walt's work or vision!
